Reviews.Title: “Quaint little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BROss_12
Reviews.Content: We booked for one night but stayed three, and also bought the spa special which gave us a mud bath, dinner for two, and free tastings at 2 wineries. Loved this unique little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a relaxing overnight trip”
Reviews.Author: Chad N
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a spot to unwind after a long work week and Mount View exceeded our expectations. We came in early Friday afternoon. The staff was friendly and got us in to our room right away. We started the weekend with a couples hydrotherapy bath and massage package. The spa area was clean and comfortable. After the spa treatment, we enjoyed a wine tasting out by the pool. When we were ready to go out for the evening, we appreciated that all the restaurants and nightlife were within a block of the hotel. The room was also quite nice and quite enough for a good night sleep, although the bathroom was a little bit of a tight squeeze. By the time we checked out on Saturday, we were relaxed and ready to face another work week. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and history at half the price”
Reviews.Author: Melihaik
Reviews.Content: Accommodations in the Napa Valley tend to be split between super high-end luxury resorts and older hotels with so-so amenities. The Mount View is the exception. The decor is elegant retro, the spa is glorious (try the seaweed bath), the rooms have great beds with high-thread-count linens, and the service is extremely personal. The staff even popped our popcorn for us and brought it to our room to accompany our movie!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel with Super Relaxing Amenities and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Katherine M
Reviews.Content: Once I walked into the adorable and chic lobby I knew this was the perfect place to stay. The people at the front desk were so incredible nice and helpful, the service was one of the best things the hotel had to offer. The room was really cute too, small but perfect for two people. The beds were really comfy with nice down comforters and great lighting for reading. Huge closet which was unexpected with amazing bathrobes, I wanted to take them with me! The bathroom was nice too, old fashioned like with the tile but modern as well with pedestal sink and lots of places to put your toiletries. Nice Toshiba TV, which was great quality. Wonderfully heated pool, with a great lounge area and hot tub. The spa was great as well with a nice mud bath and massage, this is the place to go! Wonderful relaxing getaway! Hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandKtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our anniversary and booked a package with Breakfast/ 3 private wine tours/spa treatment with dinner included at the restaurant. The room was huge, very clean, it came with 2 super comfy bathrobes. The spa was an amazing experience and very relaxing. There was a pool there but we did not have a chance to swim in it. There was a wide variety of choices at the restaurant and service was quick,the breakfast was delish, it was fresh pastries from the area with fresh oj and coffee. We loved the private wine tastings offered with the package. Well worth the visit. Only regret we wish we had booked for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous getaway”
Reviews.Author: InternationalGal
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for a relaxing time away. Loved the pool and jacuzzi, heated to a very nice temperature. Spa services were excellent, loved the hydrotherapy mud bath and massage, they have a couples treatment too. Artists Cottage was perfect, so comfortable and well designed with patio and outdoor jacuzzi. Perfect for a romantic visit. Staff are helpful and very welcoming. I will stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: JenA61
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Mount View on a Travelzoo deal. It was a great value as it also included dinner and a hydrotherapy treatment. The rooms were small, as I expected from an older hotel, but they were still very comfortable. The bed was awesome! So comfy. My only complaints were the lack of storage and lighting. The room had no dresser, but did have a nice sized closet. Unfortunately there was no light in the closet, so we had to either bring the suitcase out of the closet, or use a flashlight to find our things. The bathroom had only a tiny shelf and table. Barely enough room for our toothbrushes. Lighting in the room was poor as well. Not enough light to read. We still had a wonderful stay. The staff was very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: kathymander
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and comfortable complete with bottle of wine from local winery.Staff were very helpful in recommending restaurants and giving directions. Liked being able to walk to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic experience.”
Reviews.Author: thewinecarriage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a lovely night at the Mount View. We were expecting it to be nice, but it far exceeded our expectations. The staff made us feel so welcome and pampered. The room was modern, but warm and artistic with tons of delightful details. The spa treatment (bubbling lavender jacuzzi for 2 and steam bath) was exceptionally delicious and relaxing. We also quite enjoyed the sauna, pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LawandaK
Reviews.Content: While in Calistoga for a wedding we had the opportunity to stay at this lovely old historical hotel and it was delightful. From the moment we walked in the property and were greeted at the front desk until our departure it was a special time. All the staff were extremely friendly, courteous and made you feel welcome and comfortable. We stayed in the Hans Fahden suite. (some of their rooms are named for local wineries and come with a bottle of wine from that winery) Loved the HUGE 2 person shower and the oversized clawfoot tub. I've had apartments smaller than this hotel room. There were 2 separate bath rooms, a sitting room and the bedroom. The bed was extremely comfy and when they delivered us breakfast in bed the next morning it started my day off just right. Breakfast consisted of warm muffins, fresh fruit, a carafe of juice and a carafe of coffee. All were delicious and delivered exactly when we requested breakfast be delivered the night before. When we returned from the wedding it was great to put on our swimsuits and go soak our tired dancing feet and bodies in the hot tub and take a dip in the heated pool. Even though I only live approximately 30 miles away, I'll find another way to go back and stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IgZak
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced, and their mudbaths don't look like mud, looks just like water. But the location is right in downtown Calistoga. Recommend going to Solbar to eat. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: takalata
Reviews.Content: i took my boyfriend to this hotel for his birthday. we had never been to calistoga before so i looked on the internet to find places to stay. mount view had a weekday special for an overnight stay and hydro mud bath so i booked it. when we got there (earlier than check in time), they were able to check us in AND upgraded us to a cottage at no cost. we didn't even request it! when we unlocked the door to the gate (leading us to our room), we were happily surprised with the HUGE jacuzzi tub and sitting area that was only for us! they even included a fizzy bath bomb and terry cloth robe for our use. it was a little rainy that day but we still took advantage of the tub! the rooms were clean and they served us a continental brakfast, delivered to our door. we also did the mud bath and my boyfriend got a massage. i loved this hotel! i will defintiely be going back. it is right in the heart of calistoga so it's walking distance to the shops, food and drinks! the hotel staff were really nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but needs upgrades - badly.”
Reviews.Author: johnbhansen
Reviews.Content: The quality of the room (ours was room 113) was poor relative to the price paid (well over $200/night). The hotel is old and quaint, the staff was friendly and helpful, and it is located in the center of the town which makes it easy to walk to restaurants and shops. However, while the Mount View has done some minor touches to make rooms more comfortable such as replacing the bedding and installing flat screen televisions, the hotel interior needs a major overhaul to bring it up to modern standards. Some of the major issues: 1) Many wooden floorboards under the carpet creak - this is especially bothersome for late night bathroom runs. 2) The rooms are VERY small and not luxuriously appointed. We had a hard time finding room for 2 suitcases. 3) The bathroom was dated (tub with old-style shower curtain) with a free standing sink, very small vanity and little room for toiletries...not suitable for most women. 4) Noisy window unit heat/air conditioners with no thermostats to control temperature.... 5) Old style deadbolt locks with big metal keys - don't automatically lock on exit, and are easy to copy. 6) Very limited parking and no valet. At times we could not find any parking on property or anywhere nearby. This property has so much potential if the owners would spend the money to upgrade it...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrincessLea20
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel. The staff were very attentive and friendly. The only thing was the price. It was a pretty small room for $400+ a night. I mean, I know it was "high season" and everything but for that price, I was expecting a REALLY nice room. Oh, well. It was a nice experience anyway.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lauowolf
Reviews.Content: I can't speak to the spa, since I didn't use it, but the hotel itself was lovely, and the people running it were wonderful. There was a slight problem with our first room, and they traded us up to a suite so that we wouldn't have to move again. For that reason, I saw two rooms, a regular double and a suite, and they were both spacious, clean, and comfortable. Oh, and beautifully appointed too - I really liked the decor, the beds were comfy, and I felt really pampered by it all. The hotel is right in the middle of Calistoga itself, so the double had a view out over the side of the hotel. While it wasn't "scenic" it wasn't bad either - just looking out over the narrow parking lot and the surrounding town to the hills in the distance. The suite had a balcony over the street and was actually lovely (stars out there at night!) The double bedroom seemed roomy to me, and the suite was quite large. The pool and hot tub area were quite nice - nothing nicer than swimming in a warm pool as the evening closes in. Both of the restaurants downstairs are great, btw.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & will go back!”
Reviews.Author: lisalu91
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, perfect hotel for our short stay in Napa. Surrounded by two great places to eat & drink, we didn't have to drive anywhere! We loved walking through the quaint town of Calistoga. We took the Calistoga "cool" bike tour and had a fantastic time seeing the countryside while wine tasting at several surrounding wineries. The hotel was quiet and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The pool and spa treatments were great, not too luxurious as some resorts, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rating for excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: JJM2207
Reviews.Content: We were in Calistoga for a friend's wedding and, having just been traveling everywhere, we opted for the less expensive hotel choice and stayed at the Mt. View. It was great. The rooms are small but there is enough room for luggage. The important thing is that the bed is VERY comfortable (several people traveling with us said the same thing even about the roll away) and the AC works great. I also really liked the breakfast that was included. It wasn't just a roll and fruit, it was a warmed up delicacy and different each morning. It is also right in the town so you can walk to restaurants and the grocery store that has great sandwiches for taking to your wine tours. Some friends used the spa and had great services, we hung out at the pool in the afternoon. It was a very nice stay. I normally wouldn't leave a review for a quick weekend getaway but I feel that this one was worth the note.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and remodeled hotel in the middle of Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: nexttripleez
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, quaint, hip, old remodeled hotel in the middle of town. Walk to shops, markets, restaurants--great location. Service was great. Front desk staff professional, caring, and very helpful. Observed them lining up wine tours and limo for other groups-really helpful and eager to please. Our favorite things: clean, nicely-remodeled rooms/decor. Fabulous bedding and comfortable bed--great sleep quality. Breakfast (coffee, banana or apple, pastry) delivered at the time promised each morning without fail. Room cleaned promptly whenever requested. Aveda bath products. Nice pool area--larger than expected for a hotel this size. JoLe restaurant off lobby--don't miss it--great food. Barolo Bar off lobby--great drinks, service and food as well. Not-so-favorite things: no elevator. Rooms had window units for air conditioning-- Wireless internet did not work most of the time we were there-frustrating. And this area was on Edge service, not even 3G. Rooms were small and somewhat cramped. One room we saw did not have a closet in which to hang up clothes. Ours did have a nice closet. Be sure to ask.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: KarenM242
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at Mount View as part of a Groupon deal. What a beautiful hotel! Great staff, a personalized note with gift boxes in the room, and two wonderful wine-tastings at wineries we weren't familiar with before. The tasting at Bennessere was especially nice as we were seated in the garden with music piped outside. The hotel is clean and upscale, very nice. We loved the location in downtown Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Not my kind of boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: nithoma
Reviews.Content: Sorry but I can't agree with all the raving reviews of this hotel, the rooms are tiny and somber (we stayed in one of the "suites"), the bathroom is the biggest asset ! Breakfast is your thing if you like danish pastry which we don't ... although the coffee was very good. On the plus side ... nice pool area, located on the main street so you can walk everywhere, 2 restaurants in the lobby (careful with the business hours). I guess everything is expensive in Napa but this is one high priced place, maybe perfect for the romantic splurging soul who takes comfort in the excellent bottle of wine that is a freebie in the suite ... helps you to forget how much you paid!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, unique, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: thuryb
Reviews.Content: My review of Mount View is mixed. After researching for weeks I was thrilled to find a place that looked cool and modern yet quaint at the same time and they did not disappoint in any of those areas. The location is excellent and I'm pretty sure that I would stay there again. Mount View has three Winery Cottages with outdoor spa tubs and I had booked the Peju Winery Cottage for my boyfriend's birthday. The room was darling, not in a ruffled throw pillow sort of way, it just had a very cool vibe. It was, however, very small, but it was clean and comfortable and with the doors opened to the private patio it really made the space feel larger. Relaxing in the tub under the stars after a full day of wine tasting was incredible! It was enough space for us, it was the private patio and outdoor spa tub that sold it for us anyway, but if you are looking for a separate sitting area inside then this is not the room for you. The downside...there was construction in the alley directly behind the cottages. The first morning we awoke to the sound, sight and diesel fuel smell of a cement mixer which was towering over the gate behind our 'private' patio. Did I mention that it was 7:00 am? It was full on construction mode right outside the cottage...at 7:00am. The sweet girl at the desk seemed surprised and said that she would try to contact someone regarding the noise. The noise was so unbearable that we asked to have our breakfast delivered to us at the pool. So much for sitting on our cute patio and enjoying the morning. As we were leaving to go wine tasting the front desk girl told us that she had called the city and that they had said that it is ok to start construction @7:00 and that she would move us to another room, in the hotel, if we'd like. Again, the deciding factor for choosing Mount View was because we wanted the outdoor space. We didn't want to be in a stuffy hotel room, we wanted fresh air. Ultimately we declined the room switch and hoped that the work would be finished by the time we got back that afternoon. When we did return, the cement mixer and construction crew were gone and waiting in our room was a bottle of Korbel and an apology note from Mount View. Ok...I don't want to come off as a jerk but, KORBEL? Seriously??? We'd just spent $ 500 on wine that day, the cottage was $387 a night, we were in Napa for goodness sake and their peace offering was a bottle of Korbel. Cheap, tacky and basically lame of Mount View. We hadn't expected anything in the form of compensation and, yes, I do believe that it was a kind gesture but it bordered on insulting and just showed a lack of appropriateness on the part of the hotel. The truth is, you will still hear a lot of noise very early in the morning from delivery trucks so pack some ear plugs if you plan on staying in a cottage. This and that...Calmart is the sweetest little market practically right next door so I highly recommend grabbing some sandwiches to pack for lunch. Palisades deli which is right across the street gets a lot of press, however, after comparing sandwiches, price and attitude from staff, Calmart was hands down the winner. They have amazing fresh deli selections and pastries to die for and all kinds of breads and cheese. Excellent produce as well. Barolo, located off the lobby of Mount View...excellent dinner! Jolie is also very popular and trendy. Hope this helped!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive small hotel in the heart of calistoga”
Reviews.Author: TJBLondon
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, convenient for the northern part of Napa. Jole restaurant downstairs looked to be a busy, buzzy place though we only sampled the wine (which was good).

Reviews.Title: “wow, location, service, awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: WinoElkGrove_Ca
Reviews.Content: The room was a suite with a winery theme, very cool - it came loaded with Reidell wine glasses and a really good bottle of cab. the staff were very friendly and helpful, always cheerful. The hotel dining choices were also very good - the desserts and small plates very yummy. You can't beat the location, right on the main drag in the middle of everything. The spa was heavenly as well. the pool area is beautiful. We had mud baths at Golden Haven, about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, also highly recommend. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Postcard Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CHNicholls
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the Napa/Sonoma region when we booked our trip, and we wanted to stay in a local hotel (as opposed to a chain hotel.) The Mount view Hotel and Spa exceeded all of our expectations. The rooms were charming and clean with eclectic decor. The hotel itself was darling and the staff was friendly and helpful. My massage at the spa was wonderful. There is a great spa in the town that we are from, so I am usually disappointed when we travel and I go to the spa, but this was no dissappoinment. They also had great spa specials (I did not purchase one of the specials, but would next time around.) My husband was disappointed in the continental breakfast (brought to your room) which consisted of coffee, OJ, fruit and a muffin or scone. I was fine with it as I don't usually eat much for breakfast anyway. We also were booked at this hotel through a bicycle touring company, so our stay was basically all-inclusive, and therefor can't comment as to the price / value, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Emoskimo
Reviews.Content: An ideal place for a romantic getaway. This hotel was very quiet, quaint, VERY relaxing, large comfortable bed, unique/stylish, and great location on the main street in the middle of town. It has the feel of an inn as opposed to a hotel, which is a good thing. There are two restaurants (including Jole - supposedly one of the best in Napa - that connect to the hotel and adds to the lobby). There is a nice heated pool and jacuzzi in the back, which are open all night to the guests (so buy a bottle of wine across the street and save it for late night:) I have never been to a hotel where they actually bring you breakfast in bed (or, to your door) and its included with the room. That was a very nice extra touch. There is a pretty decent spa as well (but note that the mud bath is more of a mineral bath than the traditional Calistoga "mud" bath, which may be a good thing depending on what you want). I will return to Calistoga, and I will stay at Mountain View. This is really a cool and relaxing place in a cool and relaxing little town.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel...good staff.”
Reviews.Author: dropie
Reviews.Content: The balcony suite where we stayed was wonderful. Our friends had the room next door which shared the balcony with us, and we really enjoyed spending time out on the balcony. The rooms were clean, with retro decor, The staff was helpful and friendly. Hotel is in the center of Calistoga, so we could walk to the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and more....”
Reviews.Author: dlokteff
Reviews.Content: I spent my 50th birthday at this boutique hotel, with a spa day and overnight with my girlfriends. This hotel provided wonderful service, lots of tips, the spa is terrific, and so is the service. Could not beat the location. They also have partnerships with several of the local wineries, so were a great resource for a wine tour.

Reviews.Title: “An elite but welcoming boutique hotel and spa in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: ral_11
Reviews.Content: As an international traveller based in London, I really savoured my time at Mount View Hotel and Spa. The Spa Director, Nicole, was very welcoming and gracious. Her assistants, Mat and Matthew, were so attentive. Mat booked an amazing hydrotherapy bath for me, wonderously prepared by Yahira. The bath was very powerful and was great for alleviating stress and jet lag. I felt revitalised with a healthy glow after this bath and steam shower. I would highly recommend this spa at the Mount View Hotel in Calistoga. It is less than a two hour drive from San Francisco airport, centrally located in the main street and close to some wonderful shops and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but small room, worthwhile in the off-season”
Reviews.Author: ajroth1982
Reviews.Content: Overall, Mount View was a thoroughly pleasant place to stay for a quick winter overnight in Napa. We stayed in a standard queen room and purchased the 'Taste of Calistoga' package, which included dinner for two from the prix-fixe menu of the Italian restaurant downstairs, private tastings at two Calistoga wineries, a 25-min "mud bath" for two (more like a dirty water whirlpool, but nice nonetheless). The good: - The room was cozy, nicely-decorated and immaculate (albeit a tad small). - Mount View is located right on the main drag in Calistoga and it's an easy walk to restaurants, wine shops, and a grocery store. - Free parking off the street (not necessary in winter, but great at other times of year). - At $129 per night, the rate was reasonable. - The hotel was very quiet (as are most places in Napa during winter) and we slept like babies. - The included "mud bath" was a nice way to spend an hour after tasting wine all day. - The wine tastings arranged by the hotel as part of the package deal (at two smaller Calistoga wineries) were the best of our trip. - Close to Robert Louis Stevenson State Park, the Palisades trail and Mount Helena, which offer some great hikes. - The hotel pool and hot tub, which I unfortunately didn't get to use, was empty while we were there (again... in winter). The bad: - The full price of a room booked in peak season is probably a bit much for me, but then again everywhere in Napa is nuts during summer. Neutral: - I can't really comment on the spa services as all we did was our included mud-whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Mount ViewHotel was Fantastic 9 years ago”
Reviews.Author: LD_Traveller00
Reviews.Content: We had a very memorable stay 9 years ago having booked by recommendation. The Hotel has changed somewhat, and now accommodates a Spa of which we did not use this time. As the Cottage was booked we had used in the past, we decided to stay in the Hotel. In comparision not so good. The bed was small and very uncomfortable, the corridor outside our room was very nosiy morning and night time as the walls were thin. The breakfast was provided by room service which means you hear everyone's breakfast being served at the time requested. A lovely service only if you don't hear the delivery. We found the Hotel was overpriced for what it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay. Period.”
Reviews.Author: oregon11
Reviews.Content: I've been to Mount View a few times. Always have a super time. I travel for work and this is seriously, amongst the US and European hotels my all around favorite. Spa services are great. Very, very comfortable. Love the 'Where the boys aren't' package which includes spa services, chick flick, spa pack. I am going back again this year!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: youl839
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with nice rooms. Amazing service by the friendly staff. Good location in town for our needs. Front desk staff was friendly. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Overall, great hotel. I would stay again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Mount View Hotel and Spa really go above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and special.”
Reviews.Author: DaisyGirl82
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend a better place to stay! My family and I are frequent visitor to the Mount View Hotel and Spa. I come up here for Mother-Daughter getaways as well as with my fiancÃ© for romantic weekend getaways. The Mount View Hotel and Spa is honestly one of the most enjoyable places I've ever had the pleasure of visiting. This is by far the best place to stay in Calistoga. The location is convenient, the hotel is absolutely beautiful down to the smallest details, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. The Mount View is located in beautiful, downtown Calistoga, on the main street, Lincoln, Ave. You can walk (or bike) anywhere you need to go. There are great restaurants within walking distance... * Breakfast- in bed (you can pick your desired time of delivery), Sarafornia (don't forget to sign the wall in the back of the restaurant) * Lunch- Checkers, Buster's Southern BBQ, or pick up some sandwiches from Palisades Deli for a picnic in Pioneer Park. * Dinner- Flat Iron (DELICIOUS, right across the street, and no corkage fee) * Drinks- Hydro Bar, Barolo, or Susie's (a fun dive bar) * Wine Tasting- There are a few shops which offer wine tasting on Lincoln Ave, but I recommend renting a bike from the Calistoga Bikeshop and biking around to the local wineries. If you find some wine you like, Calistoga will even pick up your wine for you and you can pick it up at the shop later on. Beautiful trails, awesome experience! The Mount View Hotel is beautiful and they continue to make it more beautiful all the time. Over the past few years they have tastefully redecorated the hotel lobby, rooms, and pool area. It still has the feel of the historic hotel it is, but it now has a hip, upscale modern art-deco elegance. There is an outdoor heated pool as well as an outdoor jacuzzi. On Fridays, they have a weekly poolside winetasting. Awesome! The rooms have new mounted flat-screen tv's, dvd players, ipod clock-radios, and more. All rooms also have free high-speed wi-fi access. Each room I've stayed in over the years is uniquely decorated and they have each been beautiful. Although a bit more expensive, the suites and the cottages are DEFINITELY worth the money. My fiancÃ© and I are getting married in Calistoga next summer and we will be staying at the Mount View for our wedding weekend. We couldn't imagine a more perfect location for our friends and family during our special weekend. The staff here at the Mount View is awesome. They really go above and beyond to make the guests feel welcome and special. I look forward to my next visit. P.S. The MV Hotel & Spa has great weekday discounts M-Th as well as AAA discounts. I usually try to go up during the week because it is more affordable for me, but they have deals all the time, so just make sure you check the website from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms, staff, and location!”
Reviews.Author: carols_trips39
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Mount View Hotel many times, but this was one of our favorite stays. The Mount View's staff is wonderful! They make you feel special. This was our 30th Anniversary and we stayed in the Hans Fayden Winery Suite. The room is beautiful and comfortable. It has a king-size bed, a sitting area with a couch and two chairs, and two bathroom areas on either sides of the suite. One is just for a clawfoot tub. The other has an amazing shower with two showerheads and lots of room. The Mount View is located in the center of town. Once we park, we never get in our car again unless it is to visit one of the wineries nearby. Sometimes we take our bikes and ride to the wineries. There is a bike/jogging trail that leads to Sterling Winery. The Flat Iron Restaurant across the street doesn't have a corkage fee. You can bring your wine with you and they gladly serve you. Their dinners are great too. We love the clean, sparkling pool and jacuzzi at the hotel. They have a great spa downstairs. The beds are very comfortable and I love the comforter on top. They provide Aveda products in the bathroom. This is one of our favorite places to go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great town, but spacey, sometimes rude staff”
Reviews.Author: BobChristine
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Mount View during my wedding. We pretty much booked the entire hotel, including the bridal suite. We had also reserved, months ahead of time, the private lounge off the lobby as an after-wedding destination for our guests (31 adults). We started experiencing problems with the staff months ahead of time. First, they charged another guest's hotel to my parents' credit card. Totally different names, etc., so not sure how that sort of mistake can happen. They also forgot to remove the group deposit from my credit card once the group booking met their deadline -- for two months. So, two month's interest was applied to my credit card. The hotel did not do anything to accommodate the error -- no free spa session, no credit to the room for the excess, unexpected charges on the credit card. When my fiance and I stayed at the hotel 6 months before the wedding, to check out the hotel and meet caterers, etc., the staff was INCREDIBLY rude to us -- one guy even told me, when he brought an iron to my room -- that the hotel was essentially doing us a favor by giving us a discounted room for the weekend, so we were not going to receive all amenities as a result (long story there). It was an odd moment. The staff wouldn't greet us back when we came downstairs and said hello to them, weird behavior like that. Unfriendly. To make matters worse, when we arrived the week of our wedding, we found out that the hotel director had forgotten to let the restaurant next store know that the private lounge had been booked by us months ahead of time as our after-wedding destination and so the restaurant had reserved it for their private party and, of course, was not about to cancel that because the hotel made a mistake. So, we had to beg the hotel to please find us an alternative option for our guests. They ended up putting us in their spa, which was a bit odd, but at least we had a place to hang out, albeit very limited seating and very bright lighting. The rooms are nice, overall, but realize that the hotel is very old and so the rooms are not spacious. Also, if you go off-season (meaning, not during the summer) the rooms get very, very cold. There are window heating units which take a very long time to heat up the room. But the art deco style is very pretty and if you don't like down comforters or pillows, they will accommodate you with non-down. The staff, especially Eric, was very much on-hand during my wedding week for my guests, one of whom was in a wheelchair. Overall, I like the hotel, but was just surprised time and time again at how clueless and a bit off the staff could be. I think it's the younger staff members who acted this way; Cassi and Nicole (managers) were very much accommodating, albeit it was Cassi who failed to notify the restaurant about our private lounge booking. Not everyone is perfect. The hotel is in downtown Calistoga, a great location, with some limited free parking if you can get there fast enough. The town is great. The rooms come with free continental breakfast (juice, coffee, tea, fruit and fresh-baked pastries from Sweetie Pies, a well-known bakery in Napa). Aveda products in the bathrooms and a nice spa downstairs. Pool and Jacuzzi in the back. There is one computer in the lobby with access to the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased at all”
Reviews.Author: las8782
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay at the Mount View. On-line, it got decent reviews, and the pictures and descriptions looked nice. Upon entering, the lobby was very nice, but beyond that, not much good about it for us. The desk staff were friendly, but not very hospitable. There was actually no service at all in my opinion! Our room was OK, clean, the bed was comfortable, however, there was absolutely no view. We opened our windows to find a rusted out trailer out back in a field of weeds, and two flower boxes outside our window with dead flowers. There were no screens on our windows, so we also could not enjoy the fresh air. The bathroom was very small, and the shower head sprayed water everywhere. In the morning, we went down to the lobby for coffee, and found there was none, and when we asked, they said we had to wait for breakfast. We were GREATLY disappointed in the "breakfast" brought to us as well...dry baked goods, and apple and banana, and cold coffee. We went out for breakfast both days! We will NOT be returning, and felt we got nowhere near our money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Complete waste of money”
Reviews.Author: mudpuppy24
Reviews.Content: So disappointing after all the reviews. We were stranded in California because of the volcano travel chaos, so decided to treat ourselves to one last night in Calistoga. I booked through hotels.com and the rate was around $220 for the night. The hotel looked nice from the outside and the foyer area was quite funky. The front desk staff were polite, but they didn't smile or make us feel welcome. There was no lift/elevator in the building so we had to haul our bags up the stairs and the hallway seemed tired and a bit dated. The room was on the small side, a bit dated, but comfortable. The bed was so high you needed to launch yourself into it. Breakfast was delivered to your room the next morning which was a nice touch. The problem was that there was a wedding party staying at the hotel so they took over the pool area and hot tub that evening and all the next day up until lunch time as there was a wedding brunch, so guests couldn't use these. I went to the spa to see if we could use their facilities instead, but there was noone around. And then there was the noise! All night till 2am. I heard the next day that guests were making complaints up till long before then, but I don't think staff did anything about it. When I complained the next morning, the front desk lady just shrugged and said they were sorry, but as it was a wedding they didn't want to spoil it by breaking up the party. But what about the guests! If the staff had just tried to keep the noise down, I'd have given this a different rating, but they were just rude all round really. Go somewhere else that will make you feel welcome - Calistoga seemed to have lots of places. This place was just not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sglynn0419
Reviews.Content: We had a great one night stay at Mount View....room was great, good service, loved the continental breakfast, great location. Sadly, we didn't even discover the pool and hot tub until we were leaving but we've decided we must go back. Also, great wine bar attached to the hotel. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redleg71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nice stay at the Mount View Hotel for the wedding of my kid brother. The Positives: 1.)The Hotel is a perfect location in downtown Calistoga. There are plenty of restaraunts and shopping nearby, so unless, you are heading to the winerys there is really no reason to get into your car as everything is within walking distance. 2.)The staff is incredible and friendly. We were with a big group that likes to have fun and can at time be a little noisy. The staff was more than accomodating and did everything the could to make us feel comfortable and at home. In fact, the bartender went out of his way evening to make sure everyone had a good time and was taken care off, despite the fact that it was late and I am sure he wanted to get home. 3.)The Pool area behind the hotel is awesome. The have a nice pool with a great jacuzzi. There is also a nice seating area wher you can chill out and enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning. 4.) The beds were "amazing". I thought I was at a Westin! Incredibly comfortable with clean, fresh, and plush linens. Things that could be improved. 1.)The sink in our room had a very slow drain. No doubt it is a sympton of the fact that this is an old building. 2.)It could use a fitness facility. Bottom Line: I felt I got way more value than for what I paid. It was a 4 star Bed and Breakfest and would definately reccomend this Hotel to anyone heading to Wine Country.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Tania_EU
Reviews.Content: Small hotel right in the centre of Calistoga (middle of wine country) - easy to find and great for walking out to dinner (and walking home again). Large swimming pool and open-air jacuzzi tub. Free drinking water (+ ice) from dispenser. Need to book in advance to use the spa services (at least the day before) so we didn't get any treatments. Room was small with the bed dominating the room and velvet leopard cushions thrown onto it (to give an idea of dÃ©cor). Cute teddy you could "adopt" and take home for a fee. Calistoga is pretty small and this is probably one of the nicer choices there.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Elegant, and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Darjeling
Reviews.Content: They are located within walking distance from all the shops, restaurants, and spas that Calistoga has to offerâ€¦and if you donâ€™t want to walk they have a restaruant on site and a really nice spa that offers a variety of services and special discounts. The hotel offers free parking and a complimentary bottle of wine if you are staying in one of the Winery Suites. My 5 year old loved the pool and the claw foot bathtub and told me he wants to live thereâ€¦ but when I visit again, it will be for a romantic getaway with just my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Good Get Away Place in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: While on one the more charming streets in the wine country, Mount View Hotel is at most just that, charming and at least: average to bland. The lobby of this historically land marked building is of a modern retro victorian decor and looks to promice rooms with class while the front desk agent was modern without any victorian manners or modesty. (it's probably a better idea not to hire the local youth for representtion of the property) The room which cost $259 was not roomy, not blessed with good light or generous with views but was clean with nice, modern decorationsand amenities. The small, white walled and black floored bathroom featured Aveda products. Exploring the hotel I took a gander at the 5' deep pool which looked cool with and was at the time only being apreciated by a sexy hipster couple . . . strange but true. Around the pool there is a nice area set up for a bar as well as a hot tub big enough for 12. The spa was pleasant. I partook of their hydrotherapy which is a jaccuzzi with some body stuff in the water; it was relaxing. There is also a lavender steam shower for an after rinse. This whole experience left me very chill. The hotel offers two F& B options one being a wine bar the othe beilg a gem of a restaurant called JoLe (Joe.Lee) which I would eat at anytime! Our waiter was a bit of a character who used the word "quasi" a lot but was informative and friendly. All in all the stay was a good one though the walls and doors are not thick and ALL activity can be heard in neer by rooms or whatever hijinks is going on in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambiance and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: andronko
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the second time we've stayed there. It was my husband's birthday which I told them when I made the reservation. Upon checkin, they upgraded us to a king suite and when we arrived in our room, there was a birthday card for my husband. The continental breakfast was delivered to our room each morning, and it was very generous. We did not use the spa services. We did not use the pool because even though it was advertised as heated, it was not, and it was too cold. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for couples”
Reviews.Author: 92lber
Reviews.Content: Mount view hotel was a perfect stay for the weekend. The hotel is located in the center of Calistoga and within reasonable driving distance to all wineries. We were upgraded at check in to the Rombauer Vineyards suite. The room was very clean and spacious. It included a separate sitting area, flat screen tv, bath robes, luxury bed linens, and complimentary breakfast delivered to room. The bathroom was a little small but wasn't an issue for us. The hotel has a spa and after a day of biking to wineries, the hydrotherapy bath was amazing. Hotel guests receive spa discounts. The outdoor pool is heated and there are two bar/restuarants in the hotel. This is the perfect small boutique hotel and has adequate privacy. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Married in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Ian1111
Reviews.Content: We just got married at Hans Fahden in calistoga and had our entire wedding party stay at the Mountview. Cassi was unbelievable!! She was very helpful with all of our needs as we had people travelling with infants, toddlers etc. The pool is very private and the rooms have all just been remodeled. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fun or romantic vacation in the valley. We also ate at Jole which was one of the best meals i have ever had

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: oceansidetraveller
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the the Mount View Hotel and Spa was in honor of our son and fiance for their wedding. The result was a fun and happy event thanks to the staff and management of the hotel. The service and accomodations are outstanding. Cassi and her staff spent hours assisting me with coordinating and arranging a very successful wine and cheese party poolside. We couldn't have done it without them, they made the evening a relaxed and fun event. Thank you Cassi once again. We will definitley return and recommend you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Started off well--ended in disappointment”
Reviews.Author: treasuringlife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked what was supposedly a good deal at $279 for a "Taste of Calistoga" package that included 1 night's lodging, wine tasting at two wineries, 3 course dinner at BarVino, continental breakfast, and a couples hydrotherapy bath. Seems like a good deal, right? Well, the deal isn't so good if you don't get the full deal. We booked this package because it was a nice way to spend the weekend as a couple and get pampered a little along the way. Things actually started really well--the hotel staff was friendly and attentive, the room was clean and well appointed, the aveda bath products and robes provided were appreciated, the hot tub was hot and bubbly, and the pool/hotel grounds well kept. We enjoyed the wineries included, even though they were at smaller family owned wineries (one of which doesn't charge for wine tasting). We also enjoyed the 3 course dinner, even though choices were limited to 3 per course--the choices were actually good, as was the food. And we enjoyed dipping in the hot tub after dinner. To finish the night off we slept quite well in our comfy bed. The next morning we awoke to a basic but appropriate continental breakfast (juice, coffee, fruit and pastries for two) and were excited to end our nearly perfect stay with the couples hydrotherapy bath. We had made our appointment for 10am and had a lazy morning waiting for the hour to arrive. At 10am we walked to the spa located downstairs and were promptly disappointed to find out that the hotel had made a scheduling mistake and our spa appointment was not on the books. They were unable to fit us in until 3 hours later. Well, 3 hours later didn't work for us because we already had appointments to visit additional wineries that day. The hotel apologized and offered to refund $20 for the inconvenience. A $20 refund and an "I'm sorry" didn't really compensate for the disappointment when we had saved the best for last. After expressing exactly how disappointed we were, the hotel finally offered to refund another $40. They somewhat redeemed themselves with this, but the money wasn't the issue. We really would have preferred to have the experience. At any rate, we left with a bad impression because this was our final impression. I wish it would have ended better.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guests reluctant return....”
Reviews.Author: Shreddie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, in one of the suites overlooking Lincoln and was quite comfortable and happy with our room. This time, we thought we'd spring for a cottage, opting for more privacy. At $379 a night, I expected a bit more. The cottage is so tiny you've literally nowhere to unpack. There are nightstands with small drawers but no room for a chest of drawers. The closet is already full with an ironing board etc. On the plus side, the bed was very comfortable. You get Aveda products and nice robes are provided. Beware the advertised "jacuzzi" in your private courtyard. This is really just a round jetted tub that must be filled each time you want to soak. NOT a hot tub with a heat element. And you can be seen from the upper floors of the hotel so dip with caution. We also had to ask to get it cleaned out when we checked-in. The spa at the hotel is very lovely though and we had wonderful treatments. But $379 a night for a cottage the size of a walk in closet? Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Oxford_UK
Reviews.Content: After a long drive, we turned up without a reservation to be given a wonderful welcome. The reception foyer and halls were lovely and the room had been recently redone and was pristine. The bed was really comfortable as well - we had a great sleep that night and didn't want to get up to go wine tasting..... Overall, the staff were great and very helpful with directions and tips. Maybe because of the time of year, the price was also really good value. If you are coming to Calistoga as part of a wine tasting trip, this hotel is a comfortable base. We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Super Dooper!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelChica
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our tour of California this summer and thought it was excellent. Very friendly staff, very comfy room and a lovely pool and hot tub out back. I would definitely come again and would recommend this to anyone visiting Napa! 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place when you aren't going to a destination for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenofrls
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at all the Hotels in the area and were getting quite frustrated that the prices were going up and places were being booked up. When I found this place, I thought it looked cool and the location was perfect. It's within walking distance to everything in downtown Calistoga. The spa in the hotel is great too. One thing I always look for in a hotel is not to remember it much. If I remember it, it's usually because there were bad experiences. This place couldn't be further from that if it tried. Our room was a simple room, a little historical looking with a decent bed. I felt like I was staying at a relatives house and could come and go as I pleased. I was really pleased with this hotel arrangement. My wife loved the spa and I liked the sauna. We did the couples hydrotherapy bath and absolutely loved it. We were going to do it again, but wondered if we would ruin a perfect memory. One thing that wasn't there was an elevator, but I didn't really notice it until just now. Something we did after hours was take a dip in the pool. That was pretty fun and we weren't bothered. If you are looking for nightlife, Calistoga doesn't really offer any. The "Jazz/Blues" music was fairly boring. I did like the Hydro Grill bar though. It was a very friendly place, just horrible music.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: rooster0
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Napa and I wanted to write a positive review for the Mount View. While I can't disagree with a lot of the reviews that call the property average we still enjoyed our stay. We too were given a room that didn't have a great view (parking lot), so I would recommend that you ask for a view of the pool/courtyard when booking your stay. You have to realize that this hotel is in the main area of the town and there are shops and buildings around the hotel. The view can't be great in every room. The room was cozy (a little small) but the bathroom was beautiful (still had the historic tile and feel) and was very large. We were not in Napa Valley to stay in our hotel and we spent a lot of time out touring wineries or eating at restaurants so the size of the room didn't bother us. It was the perfect size to house your stuff, have a nice breakfast in bed and get ready for your day! The pool and hot tub area is very nice and large. We also had the hot tub to ourselves every time we went out which was very nice. The hot tub does not "close" as long as you are quiet at night and polite for the other customers. That was a very nice feature. The hotel is within walking distance of many shops and restaurants (again on main street) which is very nice. The Bar Vino looked good and the menu was very reasonably priced but we didn't have time to eat or drink there. The only comment that I had and I told the hotel manager this was that while the staff was all very nice and friendly the manager was excellent and showed a level of enthuasim that was great! Overall, it was a great value for the valley, and for the room and ammenities it is well worth it. (We did the vinotherapy package w/ 2 nights and 1 for free).

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay - but would not return”
Reviews.Author: ljn_uk
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on a sat night in March, check in was fairly quick (as we were the only ones checking in) After a 2 long flights (LHR - JFK & JFK - SFO) we were shattered so we just wanted to heard to bed. We were assigned room 231, A rectangular room with no view (no point even opening the blinds) Room was cosy, clean, had one bed, desk, one armchair, TV on top of a chest of drawers, bathroom was compact but clean. Design asthetic was quite traditional. Matress was a tad hard (I am a self confessed matress / bedding snob), Linens were clean but not luxurious. Did have some issues getting hot water (this affected shower & sink) - very hit & miss. We were booked on the vinotherapy package & the bottle of champagne (Korben brand - looked quite cheap - a shame really when the napa valley produces so much good sparkling wine) was in our room (shame nobody had thought to put it on ice) with glasses. Pool/Spa area was nice & empty much of the time so we had the hot tub to ourselves. Breakfast is delivered to your room (sounded like a great idea) - found the pastries to be hit & miss, somedays very fresh others a bit dry/stale. you also get a piece of fruit & a granola bar, coffee was very strong. Breakfast (continental) in bed sounded like a nice idea but in reality if was pretty average. Spa: As we had spa credit as part of the package we had booked for massages, Prior to arraiving teh spa had contacted us as they needed to change the date/time of our appointments so we arrived 15 mins before our newly scheduled appointments - nobody was maning the check in booth outside the spa entrance so we went inside to wait - after 5 mins were were quite brusquely told we needed to check in - we explained that nobody was there so we were then told to go to the hotel check in desk. Off we go to the check in desk where we are given a bit of paper with our therapists name & then returned to the spa. I had booked the hot stone massage - it was average at best, I asked for medium to firm pressure & got very little pressure, the therapist used masses of oil so I could barely feel the benefit, I could also hear quite a bit of street noise & the music kept going on and off - so the treatment room was not really a relaxing space. My fiance has a regular massage & he too was underwhelmed. It was a real shame as we had been looking forward to our treatments. Overall I am sorry to say the spa was not worth the money. Bar: We popped in planning to have a drink before dinner - place was pretty empty - after waiting over 5 mins we left without being acknowledged - Shame - the place looked nice but lacked service. The location: Was good you could walk to shops, restaurants etc. Parking: Limited. If none is available you have to park on the street outside but ensure you move your car by 11am as you will get a parking ticket. Overall the Mount View appeared very appealing from the website but was very average in reality. I love napa valley (Have visited twice from the Uk in 6 months) but would not stay again at the Mountview. It was not bad , it was just a bit below average.

Reviews.Title: “OK - Checking Out Left a Bad Taste”
Reviews.Author: brittany47
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We walked into the entryway of the hotel which looked very updated and modern. We had a spa treatment as well and the spa was meticulous, modern and very clean. The staff at the spa were very courteous and professional. However, when we checked into our room we felt like we were in a completely different hotel. The room was clean but needs updating. Old chandeliers, old furniture -- nothing like the hotel's foyer or the spa. The maitress was very uncomfortable. The stay overall in this room could have been so much better if the hotel would have provided a comfortable mattress. My husband and I did not sleap well. The walls are a bit thin as well since we could hear the couple next door until they settled down for the evening. Overall, we enjoyed the spa, loved the gals at the reception desk on Saturday but did not enjoy the mattress. On our departure, as we go down to check out and bring our bags down. There were three ladies at the checkout reception area. Not one looked up to say good morning or hello. We went up a couple of times and once again no acknowledgement. When we checked out there was no comments to us for example "did you enjoy your stay". or "please come back and visit". There was a gal running around that was there on Saturday who was extremely pleasant and hospitable but she was not at the front desk at that time. I felt like I was at a different hotel. In particular there was a blond that was not very cordial. Overall, for the money I would recommend staying at the Best Western. There the pool was nicer and the rooms more modern. A little more of a walk to town but I think it would be worth it. We stayed there and we were quite happy. Mt. View is overpriced and not worth the money. Sorry

Reviews.Title: “OK - nice enough but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Undertheoaks
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right in the centre of the town so the location is convenient. Personally I found Calistoga a little tacky (especially when compared with beautful Healdsburg and some of the other areas that we drove through on the way down from Calistoga to Sonoma). The hotel was nice enough - quite old so not in tip-top condition but equally nothing too concerning. Not a disaster if I had to stay there again but certainly wouldn't make a point of rushing back - I have been very spoiled over the last couple of years so don't be too alarmed if you already have this scheduled on your trip. It's a nice spa hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kalinka-NYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mount View Inn 10/17 & 10/18. From the start the staff was very helpful. I had initially booked the hot air balloon package then switched to the birthday package as it was my BF's bday while we were on vacation. So I was thankful they put up with my back and forth on our arrangements. We were in room 111 which was at the end of the hall on the first floor. Not much daylight in the room but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Bathroom had been remodeled and it was sparkling white. The room was a nice size with a walk in closet too! The inn had an ice bucket with a bottle of champagne in our room (for the bday thang) waiting for us. Even though there was a mess-up upon our checking in (they still had us booked for the balloon) the front desk was very kind and told us not to worry they would straighten it out. We did 80 min massages in the spa (which we were the only people there on a wed afternoon!) I had Candace do a hot stone massage and it was incredible (best I've ever had in terms of hot stone massages! I swear I think I was floating thru time). The pool area with outdoor jacuzzi was great and we used it before dinner, again we were the only people out there so it was great! Had dinner at Bar Vino which is in/next to the hotel. Great food and great local wines! We loved that this hotel was in walking distance to other places in Calistoga. At the end of the day we did not feel like getting back into the car to go to dinner so having great dinners at Bar Vino and Brennan's (1/2 block away) was perfect. Overall we would definitely come back to this hotel. I think we paid under $200/night (and we got 42% off 2nd nite because of BF birthday!). The rooms were clean, roomy for 2 people, staff was very nice and the whole hotel is very clean and serene-feeling. Spa was great. Oh, and the breakfasts they deliver in the morning were great! A pot of coffee, two 16oz bottles of OJ, 2 cereal bars, 2 pieces of fruit and 2 pastries (which they must get locally as they were delicious!) We were very pleased with our stay. True you can hear people in the hallway but we didn't feel this detracted from the hotel at all. Thank you Mount View

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Calistoga Location”
Reviews.Author: dukefan2331
Reviews.Content: Warning: Should you book with these guys, expect to pay a booking fee if you cancel. A very nice little place. Walk out your front door and you have all of Calistoga in front of you. While $160 is a pricey room, for Napa Valley this is dirt cheap. And a value given the overall quality of lodging at this price. The breakfast baskets provided were excellent. Fresh coffee, juices, upscale pastry, fruit, yum! Bar Vino is just off the lobby, and has excellent and reasonably priced local wines. The Mount View Inn will be our first choice for future stays in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “A nice room in a quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: freqbustrav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before and night after our wedding which was nearby. We stayed in cottage 1. I really don't think any of the hotels in Calistoga are that nice and certainly none are modern, but Mount View had a nice room with comfy bed and a private patio with jacuzzi tub. The white bathroom was sparkling clean with nice Aveda products. The complementary breakfast was nice and light, pastries, fruit and juice. The jacuzzi tub was great, we used it both nights and 1 monring while we were there. We originally assumed the patio was hidden from view and completely private, but we were wrong, it is fully visible from the rooms in the main hotel, be warned :) Overall, a nice stay in a room with "shabby chic" decor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave valuables or money in your room - someone in hotel will take it”
Reviews.Author: Belmontdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a suite at this hotel last weekend. The property was not terrible, although the service was lacking to say the least. The major problem with the hotel is that the rooms are not secure. We had 3 envelopes containing cash, checks and important paperwork that mysteriously disappeared from our room. When we brought it to the staffâ€™s attention, they did not seem too concerned, nor did they try and offer us anything to make up for the loss. Had this happened at a quality hotel, they might have at least offered to comp our room... or something. All we got from the hotel was, "sorry". I would not recommend this hotel to anyone... unless they don't mind having their property stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay, the room was fine but a little on the dark size as we were on the ground floor. It is on the main street so nice and central. The breakfast was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...Napa Valley Gem”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the most romantic stay at this hotel. Our room was elegant and fun, the staff was 1st class and the spa was to die for. This intimate historic hotel (I believe 30 rooms) was located in this quaint town in Napa Valley. Save the time and airfare and visit Napa Valley instead of the over rated regions of France.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was O.K.”
Reviews.Author: RoxyPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge on a cottage at this hotel for the Jacuzzi tub (which was wonderful). Even though it was off season, and kinda cold (for CA) and rainy, the Jacuzzi was great! You fill it like a bathtub (no chemicals) and you can adjust the water temp and level. Unfortunately, the room could use some work. Featherbeds and duvets? I didn't see them, maybe they are a High Season item. All the cottages have Queen size beds. BTW-what's with the Napa area and Queen size beds? Are most of the rooms too small for Kings etc.? (I think I just answered my own question.) The breakfast is minimal and kind of "Costco-ish," but the coffee is good. There are several breakfast places nearby. I'm sure the proprietors know of all the complaints about the continental breakfast, but haven't changed it, so they must find it satisfactory. (However, you'd think that for the price, they could provide something fresh from a local bakery!) The "breakfast area" consists of one worn out chair and a small round table. One of us always had to sit on the bed. The T.V. worked well, but was bolted to the wall up high, and reminded me of being in a hospital. The bathroom was fine, but the floor was really cold (I'm sure this is a seasonal issue), and a rug or two would be nice in the winter. We liked that we had a real coffee machine and a canister of coffee instead of those pre-measured packets that you get in most hotel rooms. The hotel also provides a good assortment of dishes, and in sunny weather, I can see that a picnic outside with the leaves growing and the garden blooming would be nice. A truly comfy bed and updated furnishings would have made this a top-notch experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second Year Stay In A Row!!1”
Reviews.Author: Wowtotravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second year in a row staying at the Mount View. We booked because of a friend's recommendation in re: location. We stayed in the King room and received a deal!! They have their anniversary promotion along with 15% off rooms. There was a problem with the amount that I was charged that I still need to correct. We enjoy staying in downtown Calistoga for it is walking distance to downtown. We understand that we are staying in a "historic" hotel, which means that the rooms are clean, comfortable, and have wall heaters. The bathrooms have original and/or original type fixtures and we really like the charm. The beds are really comfortable with down duvets/comforters and very soft sheets. We like that the TV is not the center of the room. The breakfasts we so nice since delivered to the room with pastries, juice, coffee, and fruit. Simple and very good. We found our second stay here just as good as the first. The staff were much friendlier and more on top of customer service. We are adventurers and so didn't ask for restaurant recommendations, etc. My only recommendation would be to call the 1-800 # for the hotel to make sure that you are charged for all the discounts and special packages that they offer. It could end up saving you some $$. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cottage very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fsi
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous and the location is excellent - right in the heart of the town of Calistoga. My husband and I were looking forward to a couple of relaxing days in a nice cottage. I especially wanted to be able to knit, read, and write thank you notes. The light in the cottage was terrible - impossible to knit and very hard to read. Although it was advertised as having a "breakfast" area, there was only one chair, and it was a low, living room type chair. There was no way to sit and eat at the tiny table. There was a private jacuzzi that was filled with leaves. I didn't feel like cleaning it so I never went in. We will not return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mumster
Reviews.Content: We went to the Mount View Hotel to celebrate our anniversary. To be honest we knew nothing about the hotel when we made the reservation, actually chose it because there was a room available the night we wanted to stay. We were very pleased with the hotel. The room was very nice, very clean and very comfortable. The desk staff were welcoming and very helpful with area information. The pool and hot tub were great! I had a massage at the spa. It was not the best massage I've ever had but I did enjoy it. We definately plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller99
Reviews.Content: This was our final honeymoon hotel. It is very old, and slightly shabby (especially the plumbing), but very pretty, with a good spa, and in the centre of downtown Calistoga. They gave us a bottle of lovely sparking wine and 2 glasses, which was much appreciated. Our room had a king sized bed and a walk in wardrobe. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, raiding other rooms for extra clothes hangers for us. The spa was lovely - we had the midweek spa break of an excellent massage each, and a romantic private jacuzzi hot tub with rosemary aromatherapy bubble bath. The hotel's restaurant Stomp (under separate management) was excellent - though have the lovely lamb chops, not the chicken breast which was like breaded nuggets. On Weds & Thurs they have 0 corkage, so you can bring bottles you bought at local wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, good spa, a few minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: hartlove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mount View Hotel in one of the cottages for one of our brief getaways (we try to do it every couple of years), and we had an overall positive experience. We will definitely try to go back. The cottage was small, but well decorated and comfortable - the Aveno shampoo, moisturizer, etc. in the bathroom was a nice touch. Loved the private outdoors jacuzzi as well, surrounded by fence and greenery. Staff was helpful - especially the concierge, who more than once offered to contact local restaurants for us on our behalf. The spa time was well spent, with friendly, competent staff who didn't give my husband or I the hard sell I've experienced at other, higher-end spas, of the products associated with the spa - a nice relief there. The only glitches at the property were that the breakfasts that came with our room - a continental breakfast delivered on a tray each morning - were just bad. Costco muffins and danishes, I think, and uniformly hard, underripe fruit. Eck. Also, there were workmen hammering and drilling just on the other side of the wall while I was having a facial, not condusive to relaxation. Otherwise, however, a lovely stay in a lovely property, and will be sure to go back next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Not so friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ChiGal930
Reviews.Content: We spent the first night of our honeymoon at Mount View. When we arrived the staff was less than friendly and I wasn't thrilled that there was no offer to assist us with our bags up to our room. Especially since there is no elevator and it was three flights up. Our room was small, but very sweet. Nicely decorated with a big cozy bed. Our view however was of an abandoned lot that was very unsitely. The restaurant that was connected to the restaurant was wonderful. I might stay again, but don't expect a warm smile to greet you when you arrive or when you are going out for the day. We took our spa business elseware as I felt there prices were too high.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Day Spa”
Reviews.Author: nirasequ
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Calistoga with four of my closest girlfriends in search of the perfect spa experience. Our drive was a short one as we came from Berkeley but once we stepped into the lobby of Mountain View Hotel we felt eons away from our ordinary lives! The concierge was not overly friendly but well prepared--she had our reservation and names out already as we approached her. It was a Thursday and felt very quiet, calm, serene. We were ushered into the spa and began our decadent day. Everything was perfect from ice cold tea available at every turn, the comfy robes and slippers, the warm staff, and the delicious treatments. Between the five us we experienced massages, Dr. Haushka facials, mud baths, and more! Once our treatments were done we were invited to stay as long as we like to enjoy the outdoor pool and hottub or dry sauna. Wew had a wonderful, memorable experience and just cannot wait to return and do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely find”
Reviews.Author: Chipper22
Reviews.Content: We drove from Oregon and planned to tour Napa Valley on our way to Southern California. So we began at the northern end in Calistoga and stayed here one night. The drive had been very warm (up to 104 degrees!) and we were very relieved to find the Mount View hotel for which I had made reservations. It was also our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We did not get upgraded, probabaly because I already had a nice discount from our Entertainment Membership. But, they had placed a bottle of sparkling wine, 2 flutes, and a card in our room. It was a very nice touch. The AC worked GREAT! We had a smaller room, but it was decorated quite lovely and the bathroom was a nice size. It is located on the main street and easy walking for the main part of the town. The pool area looked very inviting with lush plants surrounding the walkways and outdoor area. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was small but adequate and very nicely decorated. I agree with the other reviews that the breakfast in the room (or delivered to you by the pool if you wanted) was a nice touch but really nothing to write home about. The pool was small but very nice, and the spa was great. The outside bar was closed during the day so I can't comment on that. I did the hot air balloon/hotel package which is something everyone should experience at least once - what a memory. 5:30am over Napa is awesome - believe me. Parking is very limited - there is an 'alley way' down the side of the hotel that you can park in, but if all the slots are full you need to park on the street well behind the hotel and it's quite a walk with your baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtarzon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for his birthday for one night. We were immediately upgraded to a suite upon check in, so that was nice! The hotel is old but that's what gives it it's charm. We had a nice, clean room with a very comfortable bed. We chose what time we would like to have our continental breakfast served to our room in the morning, but ufnortunately, the breakfast was terrible....hard, dry patries, a banana, apple, coffee and two bottles of OJ. Not impressed with the breakfast! But overall, we enjoyed our stay and would go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great little getaway with tons of privacy!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the cottages and it was amazing. We had a private patio with a jacuzzi and two chairs. It was stunning. The rooms are small, but we spent most of our time in the jacuzzi. The service was excellent. They allow late checkouts if you ask. There is a pool, but we just took so well to our room, we never wanted to leave! Make sure to get the cottage!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to spend a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Hodkinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mount View for 3 nights after a number of days boarding/skiing in Squaw Valley for a chill before the flight back to the UK and had a great time. We were left alone to get on with our own thing by the friendly and helpful staff. The room was spacious and very clean. We didn't try the restaurant, but it was busy on saturday night. Instead we opted for Brannan's across the street on 2 nights - the lamb shank is to die for :-) I'd go back, but would suggest that you request a second-floor room, as our ground floor room with garden view was a bit dark, and at times didn't feel very private. They also have Aveda toiletries, which was appreciated greatly by my Fiance. We also enjoyed Dr Wilkinson's Spa as well as the Sterling Winery. Both definitely worth a visit. Going to the Petrified Forest and the Old Faithful Geyser felt a bit like something from the Simpsons - "come and visit the world's largest ball of string" - they are that type of attraction. Charming in a quaint way, but not soething to get too excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: SwimmerK
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently went to the Mount View Hotel for a girls' weekend away. We purchased packages for 2 nights. The rooms were very nice, updated and unique decor. Everything was clean and orderly. The beds, although nice, were not a comfortable as we had hoped. All of us had minor back aches in the morning. The walls are very thin, so make sure to take earplugs. I did and was fine, but my roommate noticed the noise. The continental breakfast delivered to your room is nothing to write home about. Basic, but if you like small breakfast, you are fine. The spa location is great, and allowed us to go from room to spa with just our robes. The spa treatments were so-so. I had a massage, hydrobath, and body polish. The hydrobath was wonderful, body polish good, and the massage disappointing. I've had many a better massage. I was a bit chilly throughout the massage (my girlfriends complained of the same) and the style of the therapist was just okay. The outdoor hot tub was nice and hot. We ate at Stomp, the restaurant in the hotel. My meal was good, although I felt the restaurant was a bit pretentious. I enjoyed the Flatiron Grille (across the street and a few doors down) better, and it was less expensive. So, overall, we enjoyed our stay. The location was nice and everything went smoothly. Staff was very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Christmas Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With all of the holiday stress, we booked a cottage with Mt. View not knowing what to expect. We arrived and checked in with a very informative, polite and helpful staff. We went to our cottage, which is adjacent to the hotel. The cottage was absolutely clean, well decorated and stocked with all of the essentials. The cottage has french doors that go out to the hot tub and worked perfectly. We were sceptical about the cottage at first, but are so happy we did it! After staying in the cottage, we will make it an annual event and something I can recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tried the spa services--just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both took advantage of the spa services at this hotel. My friend recommended it although she did not have a totally good experience either. I got a standard 80 min. massage. The environment is clean and very peaceful. However,the massage itself was just OK. The room was too cold & bright, and there was WAY too much talking. I feel for the top price I paid, the service was disappointing. I also felt the 5 min. intro conversation and the last 5 min of "laying of the hands" shouldn't have played into my 80 min. Overall I think I actually got 65 min.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: N_Franklin
Reviews.Content: The lady that checked us in was real nice and efficient. The first night we stayed in a twin room (1st flr), the room was decorated nicely but the walls were paper thin. The 2nd night we stayed in a full size room (2nd flr). Again the room was decorated nicely but; the room was entirely to small for the price we paid. There was a whirlpool in the room but it definitely needed to be updated; there were parts that were broken. And,the hotel does not have an elevator. It was HELL going up and down the stairs with all our luggage. The hotel provides breakfast snacks for you every morning. The snacks were a joke. They should give the guest choices; pretty much every morning the snacks stayed on our tray. There wasn't anything we liked. On our 2nd day we booked spa treatments. One of the therapist was definitely not qualified for the job, I felt we paid to much for her services. The other therapist were GREAT. And lastly I asked for a wake-up call and I never received it, the lady I complained to apoligized but I still missed my appointment. As you can see there were pros and cons but the cons out-weighed the pros so I can honestly say we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mnpt
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in one of the cottages for part of our honeymoon. The jacuzzi was great! Would have been nice if it was a king size bed, but I thought it was very comfortable. Continental breakfast consisted of 2 pastries, 2 pieces of fruits, juice and your choice of coffee or tea, delivered to your room. Had a massage in the spa which was very nice. I liked staying here as it is on the main street but the cottages are tucked away, very private and quiet. I'm glad we stayed in Calistoga because it was small and quaint and not overcrowded. No problems with the staff - didn't have an impression either good or bad. Ended up staying a 3rd night because we enjoyed the town and the jacuzzi. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ripped off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Mountview hotel in Calistoga, ca. I was over charged for my room and then I couldn't get the hotel to respond to my email concerning the problem. Will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Cottage”
Reviews.Author: Zin Fan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night this week in one of the three cottages. None of the common complaints by others about the rooms in the main building (noisy, outdated, etc) apply to the cottages. We enjoyed the complete privacy of our cottage as the room and bathroom were very nice and the garden area was delightful. I agree with other reviewers about the front desk - asked two questions about local wineries and got blank stares. Spa was small but relaxing. Suggest the Clos Pegase (interesting art) and Shramsburg (excellent tour and sparkling wine tasting) wineries, and the Martini House for dinner. Overall, very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed on a Friday night at this Historic Hotel and were pleasantly surprised. The last review on Trip Advisor was not very positive and I want to let folks know our experience. Our room was lovely, the feather bed the most comfortable I have every slept on and robes in the room was a treat as well as the continental breakfast brought to your room! We did a hydrotherapy Bath and Massage package midweek and the Spa is very, very nice, the ambiance as well as the staff and masseues. We will return. Only note is that you should bring ear plugs to sleep as it is a Historic Hotel and therefore the soundness is not up to the new Hotels, but I wouldn't trade the Historic ambiance for a new Hotel at all. A great place to stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: julkiana
Reviews.Content: We booked this Inn through the hotel on a balloon/room package. It was worth the $$ for the balloon ride but we weren't too impressed with the hotel. The package was definitely well priced so we can't complain too much about the cost of the room but I definitely wouldn't pay more than $125/night for this room. It was clean but smelled a bit musty and the front desk staff was less than helpful. The web site promised down comforters and 'luxury' amenities but we didn't experience that. We had an OK bed, with NO down comforter, a small TV and a small, rather outdated room. When we return to Napa, we will plan to stay somewhere else next time.

HotelInfo.Name: Mount View Hotel & Spa
